title: Details For The Weblogic User Groups In ASAP

contentType.name: FAQ
contentType.description: A simple template containing a common question and answer on a specific topic

xml:
<FAQ><SUMMARY><![CDATA[Details For The Weblogic User Groups In ASAP]]></SUMMARY><QUESTION><h2 class="km"><a name="GOAL"></a>Goal</h2> 
<p>Can you provide the details of the following users/groups in ASAP BEA WLS Domain?</p> 
<p>Administrators<br>ASAP_Monitors<br>ASAP_Operators<br>ASAP_VNOS<br>Deployers<br>Monitors<br>Operators<br>AppTesters<br>ASAP_Guests<br>everyone</p></QUESTION><ANSWER><h2 class="km"><a name="FIX"></a>Fix</h2> 
<p>Below is a list of the users/groups created using the ASAP domain template "ASAPDomain_for_WLS92.jar" under the asap_utils directory (see the ASAP Setup Guide for additional info):</p> 
<p><br><strong>1) BEA USERS/GROUPS WITH ASAP DOMAIN TEMPLATE </strong><br><br>USERS - ASAP-admin, ASAP_monitor,ASAP_operator <br><br>GROUPS - ASAP_Guests, ASAP_Monitor, ASAP_Operator, ASAP_VNOS, everyone <br><br>ASAP Documentation - ASAP Admin Guide - User security section <br><br>GUI interface security:<br>ASAP GUI interface security is managed through the WebLogic Server Management Console. <br>There are two default ASAP groups: <br><strong><em>ASAP_Operator</em></strong> creates orders, manages fallout orders, performs some AIMS <br>configuration procedures, and views audit logs and reports (in AIMS and the OCA client). <br><em><strong>ASAP_Monitor</strong></em> view audit logs and reports (in AIMS and the OCA client).</p> 
<p><em><strong>ASAP_VNOS</strong></em> the ASAP administrator must create a unique VNO group name or ID in <br>BEA. The VNO group ID must be included as a member of <strong><em>ASAP_VNOS</em></strong> group. The <br>group will be the parent of all VNO groups. This group enables the OCA client to identify <br>and recognize a group ID as VNO group ID and therefore authorize a user as VNO user. <br>Default users are assigned to one of these default ASAP groups. <br><br><br><strong>2) BEA WLS DEFAULT USERS/GROUPS WITHOUT ASAP <br></strong><br>USERS - Weblogic "user created when creating the domain" <br><br>GROUPS - Administrators, AppTesters, Deployers, Monitors, Operators<br><br></p>
